channel.title: poster on Thomas Sostarics
channel.description: Recent content in poster on Thomas Sostarics

item.title: Adjective use by individuals with agrammatic primary progressive aphasia
item.description: Sostarics, Thomas; Walenski, Matthew; Mesulam, M. Marsel; Thompson, Cynthia K (2020). Adjective use by individuals with agrammatic primary progressive aphasia. Society for the Neurobiology of Language 2020.

item.title: 'Nonetheless' can reverse predictions immediately: evidence from ERPs
item.description: Arkhipova, Yana; Sostarics, Thomas; Law, Ryan; Xiang, Ming; and Chow WingYee (2019). ‘Nonetheless’ can reverse predictions immediately: evidence from ERPs. AMLAP 2019. Moscow, Russia.

item.title: Accommodation of Rising and Falling Intonation in American English
item.description: Design inspirations: Bust a Move. Rubiks cubes. iMessage. Sostarics, Thomas; Cole, Jennifer (2023). Accommodation of Rising and Falling Intonation in American English. 28th Midcontinental Phonetics and Phonology Conference. Purdue University.

item.title: Epistemic meaning and the LLL tune in American English
item.description: Design inspirations: Ribbons. Sostarics, T., Cole, J. (2021) Epistemic Meaning and the LLL Tune in American English. Proc. 1st International Conference on Tone and Intonation (TAI), 11-15, doi: 10.21437/TAI.2021-3

item.title: Exploring the Voice Quality of Nuclear Tunes
item.description: Sostarics, Thomas; Cole, Jennifer (2022). Exploring the Voice Quality of Nuclear Tunes. 27th Midcontinental Phonetics and Phonology Conference. Washington University of St. Louis. Poster available as a high-definition PNG file. The original PDF has a lot of geometry from the faceted graphs, and as a result has a tendency to crash PDF viewers. On the poster, there are flags with numbers. Flags on the left column of the poster () denote specific goals/questions.

item.title: Testing the Locus of Speech-Act Meaning in English Intonation
item.description: Design inspirations: Riemann sums. Halftone patterns. Northwestern purple & ICPhS blue. Whiteboards. Handwriting. Sostarics, T., Cole, J. (2023) Testing the Locus of Speech-Act Meaning in English Intonation. Proc. International Congress of Phonetic Sciences (ICPhS).

item.title: Tonal center of gravity predicts variation in the interpretation of rising and falling intonation in american english
item.description: 1st Place Best Paper in Speech Communication Award Design inspirations: Magenta. Flattening. Kirby. ASA color palette. Name tags. Sostarics, T., & Cole, J. (2023). Tonal center of gravity predicts variation in the interpretation of rising and falling intonation in American English. The Journal of the Acoustical Society of America, 153(3_supplement), A78â€“A78. https://doi.org/10.1121/10.0018225
